verbs.description: quiddle (third-person singular simple present quiddles, present participle quiddling, simple past and past participle quiddled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, rare) To talk nonsense or speak vaguely, to waffle
examples: He couldn't stop quiddling about the weather.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, rare) To spend or waste time in trifling employments, or to attend to useful subjects in a trifling superficial manner.
